name: Acoustic Guitar
details: After delta blues, country music was the first style of popular music based around the guitar, and the prominent guitar lines in the recordings of Jimmie Rodgers.

name: Electric Guitar
details: The first viable electric guitar was introduced by the Rickenbacker company in 1932, giving guitarists the volume necessary to compete with other instruments.

name: Fiddle
details: First brought to America from the British Isles, the fiddle has always been one of the principal instruments in country music. Recorded country music began in 1992.

name: Accordion
details: A reed instrument developed in early 19th-century Europe, the accordion is worn like a vest and made of right and left hand keyboards that are connected by a bellows.

name: Banjo
details: Banjos are plucked stringed instruments whose distinctive tones stem from the strings being supported by a bridge that rests on a tightly stretched skin membrane.

name: Drums
details: The drums were not a part of the original instrument configuration used in country music. A contemporary drum or trap set usually consists of a bass or kick drum.

name: Harmonica
details: Invented in Europe in the 1820s, the mouth harmonica has a series of chambers containing reeds that vibrate as the player inhales and exhales and use a multiple of harps.

name: Mandolin
details: Derived from the ancient lutes of Renaissance Italy, the mandolin came into its present form as a short-necked instrument with eight paired strings in 18th-century Naples.

name: Piano
details: The piano is made up of a series of levers and linkages whose strings are hammered when activated by playing the keys with the fingers. The piano hit its stride in 1930s.

name: Zither
details: In the late 18th century, composed of a flat sound box with strings stretched across it, the zither is played horizontally with either a plectrum or the fingertips.

name: Dobro
details: The Dobro was invented by the Dopyera Brothers in the 1920s and modeled after the Hawaiian slack. the Dobro is played face up with a series of finger picks and a metal bar.

name: Autoharp
details: A member of the zither family, the autoharp is played by strumming its strings with one hand while the other hand controls a bar which damps those not in the chord.
